about_the_game:
Grand Theft Cthulhu


Dead Static Drive is Grand Theft Cthulhu. An indie survival-horror game following a nightmarish road trip across a 1980s Americana. Playing as prodigal-child Hearst, you need to scavenge, fight, sneak, and explore in order to figure out what’s happened to your parents, and the rest of the world. Evade police. Equip yourself and those close to you, and follow your own moral code.  Learn how—and who—to trust. And learn it fast, the monsters are gaining on you.

Dead Static Drive blends weird fiction and uncanny Eldritch themes with a spooky unease underlying this small-town life.
Heavily influenced by the work of weird fiction authors T. E. D. Klein, Gene Wolfe, & Ramsey Campbell, filmmaker David Lynch, and photographer William Eggleston, Dead Static Drive hopes to invoke images of an America now lost, where with the right car and enough gas, anything felt possible.

content_descriptors.notes: Features moderate amounts of comic violence.  Human characters and monsters can be fought and killed.  Features use of legal intoxicants including alcohol.
